Class ERGraph

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Graph
        |
        +--ERGraph
public class ERGraph
extends Graph

This class implements the most widely adopted random graph algorithm, in particular the Erdos-Reny algorithm

Constructor Detail

ERGraph

public ERGraph(int numOfVertices,
               double prob,
               int totalNumOfEdges,
               int seed)
Creates a new instance of Custom Random by using as arguments the the maximum number of edges, the probability and the number of vertices-nodes the graph will have.
The algorithm works as follows:
1. Start with a graph with N nodes and no edges
2. If the number of the connected edges is below the predefined number of connected edges then pick randomly a vertex v and a vertex u and connect them with probability Per ,else exit
3. Increase the number of connected edges and repeat step 1

ERGraph

public ERGraph(int numOfVertices,
               double prob,
               int seed)
Creates a new instance of ER by using as arguments the number of vertices/nodes and the probability the graph should have.
The algorithm work as follows:
1. Start with a graph with N nodes and no edges
2. Connect each pair of two nodes with probability Per.

check

           throws java.io.IOException
Check adjacency among veritces and print results either on screen or on file

java.io.IOException

printTopology

public void printTopology(int numOfVertices,
                          java.lang.String topologyFilePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Prints Graph Topology on a text file and is stored in the classpath defined by the topologyFilePath argument.
The integer argument numOfVertices is the number of vertices/nodes of the graph.

java.io.IOException
